ygData.subject: Re: Twinking
ygData.msgSnippet: Well, the good news about Twinking is that it will probably cause those doing it to get bored fairly quickly... I mean how many characters will you make and
ygData.messageBody:
Well, the good news about Twinking is that it will probably cause those
doing it to get bored fairly quickly... I mean how many characters will you
make and take up to level 50 before you finally decide your tired of it
all...

So, for those of us that plan on doing things *the right way* and following
the rules (mostly), things will start to get better over time... in fact, I
started a new character (also on Karana) and found that the *newbie* area is
practically EMPTY compared to when I first started (which was about 2 weeks
into the games debut). So, you can actually level up FASTER because there
is less competition... Also, you can level faster because you KNOW more
about: 1) How to play... 2) where to go... 3) what to look for...

So, hopefully things will only get BETTER... At least that's what I am
hoping for...

Oh, I did see ONE newbie (level 5 Cleric) who already had full banded... he
had twinked it from his *other* character which was a level 25...

Lemac Justerian - High Elf Cleric on Karana server


----- Original Message -----
From: Jason Coan <COANJ@...>
To: <EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, June 01, 1999 9:13 AM
Subject: Re: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Banks


> From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
>
> the camping problem is directly related to twinkers. when someone is
camping an item, they get their item and should move on....but they
don't....they continue to camp to get more items to twink their guild
buddies, or to twink their other characters......mean while I can't get the
item due to their twinking.....direct relationship there.
>
> The people who deserve the items are the ones that are willing to get them
with the character that is going to use them......ie no camping rubicite
with your 40th lvl wizard to give to your 5th lvl warrior
>
> greedy bastards all over the place, ruining the game for everyone simply
so they can twink out their newbie characters or friends, blah
>
> >>> Mark Guckeyson <mguckeyson@...> 6.1.99 9:57:49 AM >>>
> From: mguckeyson@... (Mark Guckeyson)
>
> What's crazy about level 5 in rubicite? It's odd, even frustrating, but
> so what? You haven't answered my question; merely given another example
> of it. Now the camping situation is something entirely different... and
> not directly related to twinking. Do you think that if they weren't
> twinking they'd move on? I sure don't. I'm willing to bet they'd just
> camp then sell the things. Actually, I'd prefer to see someone camping
> for the sole purpose of giving 'em away. After all, that just means that
> whoever they're giving them to will have no reason to camp there. And
> how do you determine who 'deserves' the items? I think you're speaking
> on a level of personal frustration... which is completely
> understandable, but difficult to defend logically.
>
> In any case, here's to few campers, great loot drops and wildly
> efficient xp.
> mark
>
> Jason Coan wrote:
> >
> > From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
> >
> > depends on what is being twinked.....a lvl 5 in full rubicite is crazy.
Not only that, but people who twink out their other characters like this are
the people who FARM items. They camp until they get their item, which I
don't have a problem with, then they continue to camp camp camp camp camp to
get crap for their guild buddies and for their lower lvl characters,
depriving the people who DESERVE the items the chance to get them....and
thats where I have a problem with twinking.
>
